page.title: 07Housing
page.content:
Rossett has grown considerably in the last 50 years. There are many different types of houses in the village.
Trevalyn Hall is the one large mansion in the area. It was once owned by the Trevor family but is now split into 3 houses.
In Station Road there are senior citizens' bungalows and a row of terraced Edwardian houses. An estate of council houses was built before the Second World War.
In 1974 a new housing estate was developed on what used to be common land. This estate has continued to expand and now there are many detached and semi-detached houses as well as bungalows.
